name.baseName: Pitch bearing(Three) manufacture of a 1.5 MW wind turbine

locationOfOperationSupplyOrProduction.descriptionOfRestrictions: The data regarding the parameters of wind power has been collected from Wang (2012). A wind farm equipped with 33 domestic 1.5 megawatts (MW) wind turbines is regarded as a case study to analyze the environmental impact and its substitution effects. The wind farm is located in the northeast of Inner Mongolia, the province in which most of China’s wind power is installed (Xia and Song, 2017).

LCIMethodAndAllocation.deviationsFromLCIMethodApproaches: The life cycle inventory for wind power is illustrated as follows. The production and manufacturing stage include the production of wind turbines, substations, and cables, which consume a large amount of energy and emit pollutants (Xue et al., 2015). Furthermore, pollutant emissions are released in the transportation stage when diesel fuel is dramatically depleted (Yang and Chen, 2013). The construction stage of a wind farm is composed of building works and installing equipment. According to Ji and Chen (2016),it is important to take the purchased electricity into consideration for the environmental impact of the wind farm in the construction stage. In the operation and maintenance stage, all technical and administrative measures are suggested to be considered, including daily inspection and equipment replacement (Joschko et al., 2015). Following the assumption put forward by Ardente et al. (2008),a total of 7000 kilograms (kg) of diesel fuel will be consumed to transport workers for inspection during the entire life span of a wind farm. The energy intensity and emission factor of diesel are based on the standard of China’s National Bureau of Statistics and Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change, respectively. Based on Guo (2012), one wind farm should be regularly maintained. For each maintenance, one blade and 15% of the generator’s components ought to be replaced. Finally, the main materials are recycled at the end of the wind farm’s life span that is assumed as twenty years.

dataSourcesTreatmentAndRepresentativenes.dataSelectionAndCombinationPrinciples: The data regarding the parameters of wind power has been collected from Wang (2012). A wind farm equipped with 33 domestic 1.5 megawatts (MW) wind turbines is regarded as a case study to analyze the environmental impact and its substitution effects. The wind farm is located in the northeast of Inner Mongolia, the province in which most of China’s wind power is installed (Xia and Song, 2017).

referenceToDataSource.common:shortDescription: Li, H., Jiang, H.-D., Dong, K.-Y., Wei, Y.-M. & Liao, H. A comparative analysis of the life cycle environmental emissions from wind and coal power: Evidence from China. Journal of Cleaner Production 248, 119192 (2020).

Li, H., Jiang, H.-D., Dong, K.-Y., Wei, Y.-M. & Liao, H. A comparative analysis of the life cycle environmental emissions from wind and coal power: Evidence from China. Journal of Cleaner Production 248, 119192 (2020).

review.common:reviewDetails: Inventory: The internal review was done by several iteration steps concerning raw data validation, raw data documentation, representativity, completeness and consistency of modelling with regard to ISO 14040 and 14044.; Documentation: The review of the documentation was performed by Ecobilan and is in compliance with ISO 14040 and 14044. The data set documentation is correct in view of the appropriateness of the information provided. It includes all relevant information in view of data quality and scope of application of the respective LCI result.
